body:
Thanks for raising this @gocurr.  More context here for anyone interested: https://github.com/golang/go/issues/54880 

Looks like eight instances to consider updating:

```bash
 âžœ find . -name "*.go" -type f -print | xargs grep .Seed
./pkg/stringutil/rand.go:                                   rand.Seed(time.Now().UnixNano())
./pkg/adt/interval_tree_test.go:                            rand.Seed(time.Now().UnixNano())
./pkg/proxy/server.go:                                      mrand.Seed(int64(now.Nanosecond()))
./pkg/proxy/server_test.go:                                 rand.Seed(now)
./tests/integration/clientv3/snapshot/v3_snapshot_test.go:  rand.Seed(int64(time.Now().Nanosecond()))
./server/lease/lessor_bench_test.go:                        rand.Seed(time.Now().UTC().UnixNano())
./server/etcdserver/server.go:                              rand.Seed(time.Now().UnixNano())                                       
```
I think perhaps you should check other deprecated APIs.

> I think perhaps you should check other deprecated APIs.

The only other formal deprecation I can see that impacts us for 1.20 is deprecation of `math/rand.Read` in favor of `crypto/rand.Read`.  I'll raise a separate issue for that. Please let us know if you spot anything else that needs a cleanup.

issue.title: Consider adopting go 1.20 as go 1.19 is now out of support

labels.name: go
labels.description: Pull requests that update Go code

repository.name: etcd
repository.description: Distributed reliable key-value store for the most critical data of a distributed system

issue.body:
### What would you like to be added?

Golang 1.21 has now been released today: 
 - https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/Mk0Jar6hfhI 
 - https://go.dev/doc/go1.21

This means 1.19 is now out of support so we should consider adopting 1.20. This would also bring etcd in line with kubernetes/kubernetes go version.

Consider updating:
- [x] `etcd/main` https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/pull/16394
- [x] `etcd/release-3.5` https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/pull/16401
- [x] `etcd/release-3.4` https://github.com/etcd-io/etcd/pull/16406
- [x] `bbolt/master` https://github.com/etcd-io/bbolt/pull/555
- [x] `raft/main` https://github.com/etcd-io/raft/pull/97


### Why is this needed?

Ensure etcd is built using supported versions of golang. Ensure the project continues to apply timely security patches.

body: We welcome contributions so please feel free if you have capacity!  Happy to assign it to you just let us know.

Seems to me, there are two approaches.

1. Since "If Seed is not called, the generator is seeded randomly at program startup." just remove rand.Seed calls.
2. "Programs that call Seed with a known value to get a specific sequence of results should use New(NewSource(seed)) to obtain a local random generator." it depends on the situations.

issue.title: pkg/ioutil: make TestPageWriterRandom run the same on all platforms

repository.name: etcd
repository.description: Distributed reliable key-value store for the most critical data of a distributed system

issue.body:
This fix came about because the test failed on alternative platforms, such as aarch64 and ppc64, but passed on x86_64. The following commit fixed the error in the test:
  fddd1add52b33649a99d7f756404924138344a10

However, the reason why this was not found on x86_64 is the incorrect use of time.random(). It has to be seeded, else it repeats the same fixed sequence. By a coincidence, x86_64 started its generator in such a way that made the test pass.

Fix: #16275

body:
hi @gocurr @jmhbnz 
is the fix in-progress or open for contribution?

I'm not working on this currently. @gocurr did you make a start on this?

> - Since "If Seed is not called, the generator is seeded randomly at program startup." just remove rand.Seed calls.
> - "Programs that call Seed with a known value to get a specific sequence of results should use New(NewSource(seed)) to obtain a local random generator." it depends on the situations.

Ideally we should be just removing the `.Seed` calls.

repository.name: etcd
repository.description: Distributed reliable key-value store for the most critical data of a distributed system
